eng_def: not in the place where you are expected to be, especially at school or work
chi_def: （尤指上課或工作）缺勤的；缺席的；不在場的
eng_sen: John has been absent from school/work for three days now.
We drank a toast to absent friends.
chi_sen: 約翰到現在已經曠課／曠工三天了。
我們為沒能來的朋友舉杯祝福。

eng_def: not existing
eng_sen: Any sign of remorse was completely absent from her face.
chi_sen: 她臉上沒有一絲自責的神情。

eng_def: without
eng_sen: Absent a detailed plan, the project was doomed from the start.
chi_sen: 由於缺乏周詳的規劃，這項工程從一開始就註定要失敗。

eng_def: to agree to take something
eng_sen: Do you accept credit cards?
She was in Mumbai to accept an award for her latest novel.
I offered her an apology, but she wouldn't accept it.
I accept full responsibility for the failure of the plan.
The new coffee machines will accept coins of any denomination.
chi_sen: 你們接受信用卡付帳嗎？
她赴孟買領取最新一部小說所獲獎項。
我向她道歉，但是她不接受。
我承擔這項計劃失敗的全部責任。
新型咖啡機接受任何面值的硬幣。

eng_def: to say yes to an offer or invitation
eng_sen: We've offered her the job, but I don't know whether she'll accept it.
I've just accepted an invitation to the opening-night party.
I've been invited to their wedding but I haven't decided whether to accept.
chi_sen: 我們把這份工作給了她，但是我不知道她會不會接受。
我剛剛接受了參加首映晚會的邀請。
他們邀請我參加婚禮，但是我還沒有決定去不去。

eng_def: to consider something or someone as satisfactory
eng_sen: The manuscript was accepted for publication last week.
She was accepted as a full member of the society.
His fellow workers refused to accept him (= to include him as one of their group).
chi_sen: 手稿於上週獲得認可，準備出版。
她被接納為該協會的正式成員。
他的同事不把他當作自己人。

eng_def: to believe that something is true
eng_sen: The police refused to accept her version of the story.
He still hasn't accepted the situation (= realized that he cannot change it).
I can't accept that there's nothing we can do.
chi_sen: 警方不相信她的說法。
他仍無法接受現實。
我不相信我們無能為力了。

eng_def: something bad that happens that is not expected or intended and that often damages something or injures someone
eng_sen: Josh had an accident and spilled water all over his work.
She was injured in a car/road accident (= when one car hit another).
chi_sen: 喬希不小心把作業上灑得都是水。
她在一宗車禍／交通意外中受傷了。

eng_def: an arrangement with a bank to keep your money there and to allow you to take it out when you need to
eng_sen: I've opened an account with a building society .
I paid the money into my account this morning.
She paid the cheque into her account.
She deposited the check in/into her account.
I need to withdraw some money from my account.
chi_sen: 我在房屋互助協會開了個帳戶。
今天上午我把錢存入了我的帳戶。
她把支票存入了帳戶。
她把支票存入了帳戶。
我需要從我的帳戶裡取出一些錢來。

eng_def: a written or spoken description or record of an event
eng_sen: She gave a thrilling account of her life in the jungle.
He kept a detailed account of the suspect's movements.
Several eyewitnesses' accounts differed considerably from the official version of events.
chi_sen: 她把自己在叢林中生活的經歷描述得驚險刺激。
他詳細紀錄了犯罪嫌疑人的一舉一動。
幾個目擊者對於事件的敘述和官方的說法有很大出入。

eng_def: an agreement with a shop or business that allows you to buy things and pay for them later
eng_sen: Could you put it on/charge it to my account (= can I pay for it later), please?
Do you have an account at this store/with us, madam?
Could you please settle your account in full (= give us all the money you owe us)?
chi_sen: 把這筆錢記在我的（賒購）帳上好嗎？
女士，你在我們商店有賒購帳戶嗎？
您可以把賒的帳全結清嗎？

eng_def: a customer who does business with a company
eng_sen: If the advertising agency loses this account, it will make a big dent in their profits.
chi_sen: 如果該廣告公司丟掉了這個客戶，他們的利潤就會銳減。

eng_def: to think of someone or something in the stated way
eng_sen: She was accounted a genius by all who knew her work.
chi_sen: 所有知道她作品的人都認為她是個天才。

eng_def: busy with a particular activity
eng_sen: You have to try to keep active as you grow older.
physically/mentally active
chi_sen: 年紀大了，應該盡量保持身心活躍。
經常運動的／思想活躍的

eng_def: involved in a particular activity
eng_sen: She's very active in (= involved in) local politics.
Enemy forces remain active in the mountainous areas around the city.
Both of his parents were very politically active.
It is important to educate children before they become sexually active.
She's an active member of her trade union (= not only belongs to it, but does work to help it).
chi_sen: 她積極參與當地的政治活動。
敵軍在城市周圍的山區仍然活動猖獗。
他的父母在政治上都很積極。
在孩子進入性活躍期之前對他們進行有關教育很重要。
她是工會中的活躍分子。

eng_def: An active verb or sentence is one in which the subject is the person or thing that performs the stated action.
eng_sen: "Catrin told me" is an active sentence, and "I was told by Catrin" is passive.
chi_sen: Catrin told me 是主動句，而 I was told by Catrin 是被動句。

eng_def: the situation in which a lot of things are happening or people are moving around
eng_sen: Economists are concerned by the low level of economic activity.
There was a sudden flurry of activity when the director walked in.
There was a lot of activity in preparation for the Queen's visit.
chi_sen: 經濟學家們都為經濟不景氣而擔憂。
經理一走進來，大家馬上一片手忙腳亂。
大家都在為準備迎接女王來訪而忙碌。

eng_def: the work of a group or organization to achieve an aim
eng_sen: He was found guilty of terrorist activity.
criminal activities
chi_sen: 他因從事恐怖主義活動而被判有罪。
犯罪活動

eng_def: something that is done for enjoyment, especially an organized event
eng_sen: His spare-time activities include cooking, tennis, and windsurfing.
We offer our guests a wide range of outdoor/sporting activities.
chi_sen: 他的業餘活動包括烹飪、打網球和風帆運動。
我們為客人提供一系列廣泛的戶外娛樂／體育活動項目。

eng_def: existing in fact
chi_def: 現實的，實際的；真實的，真正的
eng_sen: We had estimated about 300 visitors, but the actual number was much higher.
The exams are in July, but the actual results (= the results themselves) don't appear until September.
chi_sen: 我們估計大約會有300名來賓，可實際人數要多得多。
考試是在七月份，但是真正成績公佈要等到九月份。

eng_def: the process of adding numbers or amounts together
eng_sen: Twice a week the children are tested in basic mathematical skills such as addition (= calculating the total of different numbers put together) and subtraction.
chi_sen: 孩子每週要參加兩次加減法等基礎數學能力的測試。

eng_def: someone new who has joined or been added to a group
the act of adding a substance or thing to something else
eng_sen: Most working environments are improved by the addition of (= by adding) a few plants and pictures.
chi_sen: 多數情況下，只要擺上幾盆花、幾幅畫，工作環境就能得到改善。

eng_def: a new part added to a house or other building
eng_sen: We're building an addition to our house.
chi_sen: 我們正在對房屋進行擴建。

eng_def: the number of the house, name of the road, and name of the town where a person lives or works, and where letters can be sent
eng_sen: her business/home address
a change of address
chi_sen: 她的公司地址／家庭住址
地址變更

eng_def: a series of letters and symbols that tell you where to find something on the internet or show where an email is sent to
eng_sen: What's your email address?
Do you have their Web address?
chi_sen: 你的電子郵件地址是什麼？
你知道他們的網址嗎？

eng_def: a formal speech
eng_sen: She gave an address to the Royal Academy.
chi_sen: 她在皇家藝術院作了場演講。

eng_def: to speak or write to someone
chi_def: 對…講話，對…發表演說，致辭;給…寫信，致函
eng_sen: He addressed a few introductory remarks to the audience.
He likes to be addressed as "Sir" or "Mr Partridge".
chi_sen: 他向觀眾說了幾句開場白。
他喜歡被稱為「先生」或「派特裡奇先生」。

eng_def: to give attention to or deal with a matter or problem
eng_sen: The issue of funding has yet to be addressed.
chi_sen: 資金問題尚未得到解決。

eng_def: to write a name or address on an envelope or parcel
chi_def: 在（信封或包裹）上寫上姓名（或地址）
eng_sen: The parcel was wrongly addressed.
So why did you open a letter that was addressed to me?
chi_sen: 這個包裹上面的地址寫錯了。
那你為甚麼要拆寫給我的信呢？

eng_def: to agree that something is true, especially unwillingly
chi_def: （尤指不情願地）承認;供認;招認
eng_sen: He admitted his guilt/mistake.
She admitted (that) she had made a mistake.
She admitted making a mistake.
At first he denied stealing the money but he later admitted (to) it.
I wasn't entirely honest with him, I admit.
The new law was generally admitted to be difficult to enforce.
chi_sen: 他承認有罪／犯了錯誤。
她承認自己犯了一個錯誤。
她承認自己犯了一個錯誤。
初時他否認偷了錢，但是後來就承認了。
我對他也不是百分之百的坦誠，這我承認。
人們普遍認為，新的法律難以實施。

eng_def: to allow someone to enter a place
eng_sen: Each ticket admits one member and one guest.
Men will not be admitted to the restaurant without a tie.
A gap between the curtains admitted the faint glimmer of a street lamp.
chi_sen: 每張票可以讓一位會員和一位客人進入。
不繫領帶的男士不允許進入這家餐廳。
街燈那微弱的光從窗簾間的一道縫隙透了進來。

eng_def: to allow a person or country to join an organization
eng_sen: Spain was admitted to the European Community in 1986.
chi_sen: 西班牙於1986年被接納為歐洲共同體成員。

eng_def: to allow someone to enter a hospital because they need medical care
eng_sen: She was admitted to hospital suffering from shock.
She was admitted to the hospital suffering from shock.
chi_sen: 她因中風被送入醫院救治。
她因中風被送入醫院救治。
